dot: digraph LinksysRouterVulnerability{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor=lightgrey];A[label="Linksys Velop Routers Vulnerability" shape=ellipse fillcolor=lightblue];B[label="Routers Sending Wi-Fi Credentials in Plaintext" fillcolor=lightyellow];C[label="Affected Models: Velop Pro 6E & Pro 7" fillcolor=lightyellow];D[label="Data Packets Include:" fillcolor=lightyellow];E[label="SSID Name and Password" fillcolor=lightgreen];F[label="Identification Tokens" fillcolor=lightgreen];G[label="User  Session Access Token" fillcolor=lightgreen];H[label="Potential for MITM Attack" fillcolor=lightpink];I[label="Linksys Response:" fillcolor=lightyellow];J[label="No Effective Measures Taken" fillcolor=lightcoral];K[label="Recommendation: Change Wi-Fi Credentials via Web Interface" fillcolor=lightyellow];L[label="Security Implications for Personal & Professional Use" fillcolor=lightpink];M[label="Testaankoop's Warning: Do Not Buy Affected Routers" fillcolor=lightcoral];A->B;A->C;A->D;D->E;D->F;D->G;A->H;A->I;I->J;A->K;A->L;A->M;H->L;}

title: The zombie misconception of theoretical computer science
dot: digraph G{node[shape=box];A[label="Zombie Misconception in Theoretical Computer Science"];B[label="Computability vs. Individual Questions"];C[label="Constant Functions: f(x) = 1 if God exists, 0 otherwise"];D[label="P vs NP: Individual Question vs. NP-hardness"];E[label="Busy Beaver Function: BB(n)"];F[label="Misapplication of Concepts"];G[label="Computability: Existence of Programs vs. Difficulty in Finding Them"];A->B;A->F;B->C;B->D;B->E;F->G;H[label="Computable Functions: Examples"];I[label="Uncomputable Functions: Busy Beaver"];J[label="Philosophical Implications"];C->H;E->I;G->J;K[label="Common Misunderstanding: 'Is BB(6) computable?'"];L[label="Misconception: Individual integers vs. Infinite sequences"];F->K;F->L;}
